title: 15th Century 'Burgandika' Manuscripts
content:
I have started looking at 15th Century Belgian/Flemish 'Burgandika' manuscripts in Boston area collections, the kind that Gerrit Noordzij recommends. I am of course looking for contextual alterations ligatures & so on. Has anybody on Typophile preceded me in looking at this stuff?

I am also going to be looking at some Gutenburg pages for related reasons. What ligatures should I be on the look out for?

Cheers!
author: ebensorkin

comments.content: Have you been to the Houghton Library at Harvard yet? That's about the best place I can think of around here.
Yes, that is where I am going. Up till today I have been at the Boston Public Library which seems to be pretty fantastic as well.
Hmm...that would have been my second suggestion. What about the [Athenaeum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022102202/http:/www.bostonathenaeum.org/)?
I will have to check that out!
